intro: Crepinella pallens, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens or borders. Crepinella pallens is valued for its ornamental appeal and is relatively easy to cultivate in temperate climates.
